abstracts.cdata!:
The Development Learning Center (DLC)
            Project for Malawi aims to test the effectiveness and
            sustainability o f a development learning center in Malawi
            as part o f a global knowledge- sharing network to
            strengthen the capacity of public, private and civil society
            decision makers and implementers to design, plan, and manage
            social and economic development policies and programs
            components. The project has four components. Component 1
            constructs and installs the DLC, setting up its
            institutional, physical, and human resource requirements,
            including purchase and installation of equipment,
            recruitment of the director and other key staff, and
            installation and configuration of the financial management
            system, Component 2 assists the DLC in establishing
            operations and becoming financially viable, and includes
            financing operational costs, purchasing vehicles to
            facilitate transport and marketing services, providing
            technical assistance for staff training, and establishing
            financial management systems and annual audits, along with
            support to local content development. Component 3
            establishes and supports sub-Centers, and includes
            constructing facilities, purchasing and installing
            equipment, recruiting sub-Center staff, and financing
            operational costs. Component 4 carries out monitoring and evaluation.
